4A78E4A95B7F432F990D4780A41D5CF2.description:

stions, ideas and multiple points of view in

oral means

3B43B3C05FAC40839650727031519CDE.description: Evaluate the relevance of electronically accessed information to a particular topic

6B8D524A076F42A2B2EB2C764C89625F.description:

C648B75E9C38409D99875F8CF8A5672D.description: Plan and conduct a search, using a wide variety of electronic sources

75CD97A24B2148DDA276468329661E98.description: Include and organize references as part of research

9527E82FA9CE47DB9BBDCA314B6B3E24.description:

12EB8CC2F5914DC8B996149A3A5FA175.description: Formulate new questions as research progresses

A5558075A6414731B274C6C45901771E.description:
Determine how information serves a variety of purposes and that the accuracy or relevance of

C7D86F23E0D7484BA69F30C92A74AAF4.description: Draw conclusions based upon research and evidence

F4C4A20E24C74E0396010E0AA90758C8.description: Develop a position that is supported by information gathered through research

D96B83D113CA42B19A6CC6DCADDBD880.description:
Support and participate in activities and projects that promote the well-being and meet the 
particular needs of their community

E10A0BC5AF96469E9BA12DF5DD113401.description:

A5434FB2C0214A38AE57A03B96C1DAFB.description: Consider the needs and perspectives of others

3986E1E470D54BFC948008FAF645DB25.description: Identify and use a variety of strategies to resolve conflicts peacefully and equitably

Demonstrate skills of cooperation, co
nflict resolution and consensus building:

87C1AF740D7146FB8FD702EE6E2B6483.listId: Social Particiapation as a Democratic Practice

739881688B89476DB9CECF34909D141E.description:
Evaluate choices and progress in problem solving, then redefine the plan of action as

783B1D92EFC541F2B6254AEB335DE6FF.description:
Predict outcomes of decision-making and problem-solving scenarios from multiple

C8B218974CC443AEB83ECEE60F34BB77.description: Demonstrate skills of decision making and problem solving:

91EC93B5BD2F4F45BDD5B649500F367C.description:
Construct and interpret maps to broaden understanding of issues, places and peoples of

ongitude, population density, waterways)

6B0EC7584CDA4C90A324104028CFD84C.description: Create a simulation or a model, using technology that permits the making of inferences

754BA00E708B40DEA94C981FDEFA1513.description:
Distinguish cause, effect, sequence and correlation in historical events, including the long-

9381D5D39D15483E8AF68421F2E29664.description: Explain the historical contexts of key events of a given time period

ACA4F582D6A446D19454B921219ECD6E.description: Use historical and community resources to organize the sequence of historical events

FC3C3C3CF5DA4E2293285F07874CE591.description: Analyze historical issues to form or support an opinion

298ECAEA4BFE403A9058F420D9B5A28F.description: Access diverse viewpoints on particular topics, using appropriate technologies

0765A09B969F4BF383E22F82FA0AB51F.description: Generate creative ideas and strategies in individual and group activities

3F7DB2A677A54E74BA4D450DEE85238E.description: Re-evaluate personal opinions to broaden understanding of a topic or an issue

7C22E0BEE591470B9FBD0B4F217C727C.description: Demonstrate the ability to analyze local and current affairs

45558C315ADC479DB5BE7F1532FDF6A3.description: Evaluate, critically, ideas, information and positions from multiple perspectives

2BE81E514F784346BCA8A91833D03F46.description:
Determine the validity of information based on 
context, bias, source, objectivity, evidence 
and/or reliability to broaden understanding of a topic or an issue

E2CE04AD937647F299A379CEA196FE8B.description: Develop skills of critical thinking and creative thinking:

D2A10E4EE6014BE8AF2C2C8970D46906.description:
What effects have La Société Radio-Canada (SRC) and the Canadian Broadcasting 
Corporation (CBC) had on Canadian identity?

092F9C474A914389A49B08E0C1CE7D63.description:
In what ways did technological advances co
ntribute to the development of Canada  
(e.g., aviation, farming equipment, radio transmissions, electronics, multimedia)?

F1AE5C9E1D7C469BA410761D7B2E5A3A.description:
How did the emergence of large factories in Canada contribute to the development of 
Canada’s economy?

09195FFA0F7B4F59A1C458EEEB89E0A1.description: What impact has increased urbanization had on rural communities in Canada?

C7BCFB1BCEF446609C24A08F90DC7EDF.description:
Assess, critically, the impact of urbanization 
and of technology on individual and collective 
identities in Canada by exploring and reflecting upon the following questions and issues:

0B963ABBDDDA411C9DBE565096E59F17.description:
What strategies and conditions are needed for the Franco-Albertan community to counter 
assimilation?

91AA1ABBE0664ED8BF408D7495755B7F.description:
How have Canadian immigration policies contributed to increased diversity and 
multiculturalism within the Canadian population?

8B64883E65C746C3BD11B994071DA815.description:
How has the 
Official Languages Act
 contributed to bilingualism in Canada?

4D9487AEED8744BDA55FBC0CAE13524B.description:
What challenges and opportunities have emerged as a result of increases in the Aboriginal 
population in western Canada?

89AA48BE8E0E42C9BE8182757C41DC22.description:
What are the social and economic effects of the changing roles and images of women in 
Canadian society (i.e., right to vote, working conditions, changing family structures)?

4AC55D92AB714F0C8A6F55A247948B28.description:
How did joining Confederation impact th
e citizens of Newfoundland?

5268F912A1CF4B2DAC8E240193CF0D21.description:
What were the reasons for, and the consequences of, Newfoundland’s joining 
Confederation?

CEAF905FA25D4214BA65D3F2C62E9BE4.description:
Assess, critically, the impacts of social a
nd political changes on individual and collective 
identities in Canada since 1918 by exploring and reflecting upon the following questions 
and issues:

7480755607B6417BB049C63B24C468F4.description: What were the underlying reasons for the negotiation of the numbered treaties?

4104C4FF5E8B4091A31CB96640359743.description:
How were the needs of varied populations considered through the creation of Alberta and of 
Saskatchewan?

54476094403F42AD873D5646F21975B4.description: What factors led to Prince Edward Island’s joining Confederation?

1AF5390E7D93493792B522297F92958D.description: What factors led to British Columbia’s joining Confederation?

D313167AA5504C30983F6FE58B96CCDC.description:
To what extent was agricultural activity a key factor in the population growth of western 
Canada?

32627AF53BD347A89A5EFE5B6752FE0F.description:
How did immigrants from eastern Europe contribute to the development of western Canada 
(i.e., health, education, churches, commerce, politics, journalism, agriculture)?

8D277E9EDE654EAABB7E912DC3314517.description:
How did communities, services and businesses established by Francophones contribute to 
the overall development of western Canada (i.e., health, education, churches, commerce, 
politics, journalism, agriculture)?

198252FB37C545A1B726FA88228150C6.description: What impact did immigration have on Aboriginal peoples and on communities in Canada?

908789BF3DB14656B3B704780985BA24.description:
What strategies were used by religious communities and missionaries to encourage 
migration and immigration to western Canada from eastern Canada and the United States?

73B73426CC6C45ACAA6CCA9EB5FDFE31.description: What strategies were used by the government to encourage immigration from Europe?

1E7DBF6347304B6A8E1E344160DC1669.description:
What was the role of the North West Mounted Police in the development of western 
Canada?

C4D86FE6BF584B8399D941CB1A189B6B.description: In what ways did the building of the Canadian Pacific Railway affect the growth of Canada?

21C7E5780B25451FA69FE9FA367ADC6F.description:
How did Asian immigrants contribute to the de
velopment of Canada (i.e., Chinese railway 
workers)?

AAB46092F59E473EA0ED45CA73A0F9B7.description:
How did changing demographics resulting from C
lifford Sifton’s immigration policies affect 
the collective identity of Francophones in communities across western Canada?

B85F52C3C96F4A21B2AE70B6E6D7EDC1.description:
How did the National Policy determine the economic and demographic aspects of Canadian 
expansion?

4B49D0B387D54E73A2208E8DDC9BF63C.description: What factors led to the purchase of Rupert’s Land in 1869?

0BF29F91406243468E7E362D90F436FA.description:
Evaluate the impact of Confederation and of
 subsequent immigration on Canada from 1867 
to the First World War by exploring and reflecting upon the following questions and issues:

7F0C6DF8B0124555B3A4247EF50C2808.description:
To what extent were the 
Manitoba Schools Act
 and evolving educational legislation in the 
Northwest Territories attempts to impose a British identity in western Canada?

52B7FE556AB7426D8ED65EA8CDC40801.description:
How was the creation of Manitoba an attempt to achieve compromise between the Métis, 
First Nations, French and British peoples?

E8578F3D3ACB4A7BB30149104A302972.description:
What were the Métis, First Nations, French and 
British perspectives on the events that led to 
the establishment of Manitoba?

2876F0B6DB2E4D51AA083D0401590055.description:
To what extent were the Red River Resistance and the second Métis uprising means to 
counter assimilation?

69E50997B71B4473B90EE7C53F256208.description:
How did the Government of Canada’s response to the Red River Resistance and the second 
Métis uprising solidify Canada’s control of the West?

F572DA0F04CB44BBBD47BEDBBDF523A5.description:
What similarities and differences exist between the causes of the Red River Resistance in 
1869 and the causes of the second Métis uprising in 1885?

6FCB17BD43564FD6A136C4465A04E321.description: What factors led to Louis Riel’s emergence as the leader of the Métis?

88C8745D60994FA3936A3CC8394C5B25.description:
Assess, critically, the role, contributions and influence of the Red River Métis
on the 
development of western Canada by exploring and reflecting upon the following questions 
and issues:

A82CFA4BE4FB4DCDAEE42BAFB7A765FD.description:
Appreciate the challenges that individuals 
and communities face when confronted with 
rapid change

4AEC410CEC874D868E78AEF160CC63A2.description: Recognize the positive and negative consequences of political decisions

AB718C21BDFB4A458160DE3E16BEAA86.description: Recognize the positive and negative aspects of immigration and migration

A47CE6ABA0A746C1ABBC55EDF7317CAA.description: To what extent was Confederation an attempt to strengthen the Maritime colonies?

BA0889FE74D64149B306611E0D5AC76A.description:
To what extent was Confederation an attempt to provide the populations of Québec and 
Ontario with increased control over their own affairs?

28DD6A2FBC8C477AA0702A5FE8D6A7A5.description:
How was the Act of Union of 1840 an attempt to resolve the issues raised by the 1837 and 
1838 Rebellions in Lower Canada and Upper Canada?

39F50FC3AA084E8F8FBA590262D38EFD.description:
How was the Great Migration of 1815–1850 in Upper Canada and Lower Canada an attempt 
to confirm British identity in the Province of Canada?

66E873732FD64E2C876609C5070E92AA.description: How did the War of 1812 contribute to defining Canada’s political boundaries?

A12EF882C72A4B4CADD849DF81843034.description: How did the War of 1812 contribute to British identity in Canada?

74A548C385884A0E875A435D9141FC71.description: What was the role of Chief Tecumseh in the War of 1812?

88F17A437FB24E17B7B9E7B061BB85AA.description:
How did the Québec Act of 1774 contribute to the foundations of Canada as an officially 
bilingual country?

1CEB2053672C459DA66BE3F85A75A150.description:
How was the Royal Proclamation of 1763 an attempt to achieve compromise between the 
Aboriginal peoples, the French and the British?

B382815FF1DC4E6DA32F0E3E35499B5B.description: What was the role and intent of Chief Pontiac in controlling British forts?

F7FF2167C92C4B6CB4C3D939384D537B.description:
Assess, critically, how political, economic and military events contributed to the 
foundations of Canada by exploring and reflecting upon the following questions and issues:

14C8801C2A264A91A1E4862C299A55DE.description:
How was British North America impacted by rebellion in the 13 colonies and by the 
subsequent Loyalist migration?

3EAC207206D443BB83BECC8598CD350D.description:
To what extent was the Battle of the Plains of Abraham the key event in achieving British 
control over North America?

07C0ABA0F4894D8287BA8D356BF7DE0E.description:
How did conflicts between the French and the British in Europe become factors in the Great 
Deportation of the Acadians in 1755?

B90798718AEA4F8E9803F64CD7FE5D22.description:
In what ways did conflicts between the French and the British in Europe impact North 
America?

1D0D7C8DE9CC4B53ADFF29E4E684ECEA.description:
Assess, critically, the political competitio
n between the French and the British in 
attempting to control North America by exploring and reflecting upon the following 
questions and issues:

AD46CE80C4BC456DAB76034B2B80C211.description: What was the role of mercantilism before and after the 1763 Treaty of Paris?

2F6543DA16704EE2A7B59DDB35DE5445.description:
How was economic development in New France impacted by the changing policies of the 
French Royal Government?

97BED5CEB527471B8AEEC32863FD6834.description: How was Britain’s interest in the fur trade different from that of New France?

F74B1B8BD0EB4A75831B03C7F94318E3.description: How did the fur trade contribute to the foundations of the economy in North America?

E5A99DDB760440839A9C5365310EBC0C.description:
How did the First Nations, French, British and Métis peoples interact with each other as 
participants in the fur trade?

FF52479DBBA743988A4A6503CD6718E2.description:
Assess, critically, the economic competition related to the control of the North American 
fur trade by exploring and reflecting upon the following questions and issues:

437351085D0944149A7027DBBA054CE5.description: What role did the British government play in the settlement of North America?

959DE2D175BD454191F97771B1714843.description:
Who were the key figures in the British expl
oration and settlement 
of North America?

71E4E977381B4F64B1DC571472C9E13F.description:
What roles did the Royal Government and the Catholic Church play in the social structure of 
New France (i.e., governor, intendant, Jesuits, religious congregations)?

DFEB6554CDCC45408AC4AC351958C3D4.description:
Who were the key figures in the French expl
oration and settlement 
of North America?

1983006E322F4C6EA8062EFC3B28346F.description:
How was European imperialism responsible for the development of Acadia, New France and 
British settlements?

3BB5E38CDECE4034A077478DFD069C02.description:
In what ways did European imperialism imp
act the social and economic structures of 
Aboriginal societies?

173B378D52B44DAE81356C8E912FA841.description: What were the social and economic factors of European imperialism?

F5CDC7DE71F24643907EDE9D8E9F5DC1.description:
How did the structures of Aboriginal societies affect decision making in each society  
(i.e., role and status of women, consensus building)?

7084AE652039456481CF00D704BB2DAA.description:
What were the different ways in which Aboriginal societies were structured (i.e., Iroquois 
Confederacy, Ojibwa, Mi’kmaq)?

2FE8D5610CF84B91A3989C44F64FB79B.description:
compare and contrast diverse social and econ
omic structures within the societies of 
Aboriginal, French and British peoples in 
pre-Confederation Canada by exploring and 
reflecting upon the following questions and issues:

C3964A11A3FF4C85BE8B0697BFFEA1B6.description: Appreciate the challenges of co-existence among peoples

0930CC0DF22C42CD8D9174650CA6A1FD.description:
Appreciate the influence of diverse Aboriginal, French and British peoples on events 
leading to Confederation
